degreeAwarded: Bachelor of Science and Master of Public Policy
fullProgramDescription: The B.S./MPP program in Oceanic and Atmospheric Sciences is an interdisciplinary major that combines the natural sciences, mathematics, and policy. Students in this program gain a strong foundation in the sciences, with a focus on oceanic and atmospheric processes, as well as training in public policy to address the complex environmental challenges facing society.
shortProgramDescription: The Oceanic and Atmospheric Sciences B.S./MPP program at UC San Diego provides students with a comprehensive understanding of oceanic and atmospheric sciences and prepares them for careers in policy and research.
classHighlights: The program includes foundational courses in mathematics and science, such as calculus, physics, and chemistry, which provide a basis for understanding oceanic and atmospheric processes.
Students take core courses in oceanic and atmospheric sciences, including dynamics, thermodynamics, and physical oceanography, to gain a deep understanding of the Earth's systems.

Electives allow students to explore specialized topics, such as climate change, oceanography, and atmospheric science, and to develop a deeper understanding of the complex interactions between the oceans and atmosphere.
The program also includes coursework in public policy, including economics, politics, and policy analysis, to prepare students for careers in policy and management.
Research opportunities are available through the Scripps Institution of Oceanography, allowing students to work with faculty on research projects and gain hands-on experience in the field.
learningOutcomes: Understand the fundamental principles of oceanic and atmospheric sciences, including dynamics, thermodynamics, and physical oceanography.
Analyze complex environmental problems and develop effective policy solutions.
Apply scientific knowledge to real-world problems, including climate change, ocean conservation, and environmental management.
Communicate complex scientific information to diverse audiences, including policymakers, stakeholders, and the general public.
Work effectively in teams to address complex environmental challenges.
additionalInformation: The program is administered by the Scripps Institution of Oceanography. Students must apply to the MPP program in their junior year. Research opportunities are available through Scripps.
